gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the bottom of the usable part of the construction. NOTE: The bottom of usable part of a building is generally its lowest underground floor.
gml:Definition.gml:name: bottomOfConstruction

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the entrance of the construction, generally the bottom of entrance door.
gml:Definition.gml:name: entrancePoint

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at eave level, anywhere between the lowest and the highest eave levels of the construction. NOTE: in case of a roof having a symmetry axis, values generalEave, lowestEave and highestEave are equivalent.
gml:Definition.gml:name: generalEave

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at roof level, anywhere between the lowest edge roof level and the top of the construction.
gml:Definition.gml:name: generalRoof

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at roof edge level, anywhere between the lowest and the highest roof edges of the construction. NOTE: in case of a roof having a symmetry axis, values generalRoofEdge, lowestRoofEdge and highestRoofEdge are equivalent.
gml:Definition.gml:name: generalRoofEdge

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the highest eave level of the construction.
gml:Definition.gml:name: highestEave

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the highest point of the construction, including the installations, such as chimneys and antennas.
gml:Definition.gml:name: highestPoint

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the highest roof edge level of the construction.
gml:Definition.gml:name: highestRoofEdge

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the lowest eave level of the construction.
gml:Definition.gml:name: lowestEave

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the level of the lowest floor above ground. This value is of interest for over-hanging buildings or for buildings on pylons.
gml:Definition.gml:name: lowestFloorAboveGround

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the lowest roof edge level of the construction.
gml:Definition.gml:name: lowestRoofEdge

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the top level of the construction. NOTE: for buildings, it is generally top of the roof.
gml:Definition.gml:name: topOfConstruction

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the top of the highest Thermal Boundary.
gml:Definition.gml:name: topThermalBoundary

gml:Definition.gml:description: The elevation has been captured at the bottom of the lowest Thermal Boundary.
gml:Definition.gml:name: bottomThermalBoundary
